The Bombardier CRJ family is a popular regional jetliner.

In-Game

CRJs are one of the most recommended starting aircraft (along with their sister family, the DHCs), and were quickly removed of their Low Demand discount and became a small crisis[1]. The CRJ1000 is the most popular plane, at 580 units ordered. The CRJ700 is the second most ordered plane with ~300 units, and then the CRJ900. Between the CRJ100/200, the CRJ200 has a few more orders.

Comparing to similar sized Embraers, the CRJ is still more popular, although is slowly losing it's title to the ERJ series. The EMB190 has ~450 orders.

Specs

Bombardier CRJ Specs (Real-life)[2]
CRJ100/200 CRJ700 CRJ900 CRJ1000
Length 26.77 m (87 ft 10 in) 32.3 m (106 ft 1 in) 36.2 m (118 ft 11 in) 39.1 m (128 ft 5 in)
Wingspan 21.18 m (69 ft 6 in) 23.2 m (76 ft 3 in) 24.9 m (81 ft 7 in) 26.2 m (85 ft 11 in)
Height 6.30 m (20 ft 8 in) 7.6 m (24 ft 10 in) 7.5 m (24 ft 7 in) 7.5 m (24 ft 6 in)
Engine General Electric GE CF34-3A1 (CRJ100)/GE CF34-3B1 (CRJ200) General Electric GE CF34-8C5B1 General Electric GE CF34-8C5 General Electric GE CF34-8C5A1

Trivia

  • Bombardier no longer sells or produces the CRJ series, as it has sold the program to Mitsubishi.
  • There are other variants in the CRJ family not in-game: the CRJ100SF/LR/SE, CRJ200PF/LR/SF, CRJ440 (smaller variant), CRJ500 (smaller CRJ700), Challenger 800/850 (the business jet version of the CRJ200), and a CRJ705 (a heavy business class cabin for the CRJ900).
